==Dutch Low Saxon== ===Verb=== {{head|nds-nl|verb}} # to [[find]] ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|vinden}}, from {{inh|de|goh|findan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*finþaną}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*pent-||to go, pass; path, bridge}}. Cognate with {{cog|nds|finden}}, {{cog|nl|vinden}}, {{cog|en|find}}, {{cog|da|finde}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈfɪndn̩]|[ˈfɪndən]}} * {{rhymes|de|ɪndn̩}} * {{audio|de|De-finden.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-finden.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=3|findet|fand|gefunden|past subjunctive=fände}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[find]]; to [[discover]] # {{lb|de|transitive|with a noun phrase and a predicate adjective}} to [[think]] that (something) is (a certain way); to [[consider]] (something) to be (a certain way); to [[find]] # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to find one’s way ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|find|fand|gefunden|h|e||fänd|a}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|abfinden}} * {{l|de|auffinden}} * {{l|de|befinden}} * {{l|de|einfinden}} * {{l|de|empfinden}} * {{l|de|erfinden}} * {{l|de|herausfinden}} * {{l|de|vorfinden}} * {{l|de|stattfinden}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Middle English== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|enm|ang|findan}}, from {{inh|enm|gem-pro|*finþaną}} (with levelled {{w|Verner's Law}} alternations). ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|enm|/ˈfiːndən/|/ˈfindən/}} ===Verb=== {{enm-verb|stem=find|3='''[[fond]]''', '''[[fand]]'''|4='''[[funden]]''', '''[[yfunden]]'''}} # {{lb|enm|transitive}} to [[find]]; to [[discover]] ====Conjugation==== {{enm-conj|type=strong|class=3|stem=find|10=funden, yfunden|11=fond, fand|12=funden|13=fond, fand, funde|14=funden|15=fond, fand|16=funden|17=funde|18=funden}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|en|find}} * {{desc|sco|find}}, {{l|sco|fynd}} [[Category:Middle English class 3 strong verbs]]
